History: Present history: Client attends parties every weekend where half the times they are about activities without alcohol like board games and remaining half times it involves alcohol. She enjoys both of them stating board game non-alcoholic parties are enjoyable and relaxing whereas parties involving alcohol are fun but tiring; Family history: Client lives with her father, mother, elder brother and a dog. Her brother is 8.5 years elder to her. One of her aunts consumes alcohol frequently; Personal history- Use of leisure time: Client has an inclination towards music since the age of 10 years and is a part of a band; Fantasy life: She wishes to enter a medical school for her career.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Rapport formation was initiated and was established and client was cooperative; Mood: Calm; Affect: Broad
Issues discussed in Current Session: Client's general interests, hobbies and leisure time activities were discussed. Her psychoactive substance consumption especially alcohol was also explored. It was established she drinks occasionally in parties and her consumption is in safe boundaries.
Reflections by the therapist: Client was aware of the harmful consequences of drinking. Her alcohol consumption has safe boundaries and she is ambitious.
